scaledmarkets.dabl.analyzer

Class IdentHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • scaledmarkets.dabl.analyzer.IdentHandler

  • public abstract class IdentHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    An IdentHandler is attached to enclosing scopes when a symbol is not recognized but might be defined later in an enclosing scope. Later, when the symbol is defined, attached Handlers are checked to see if any refer to the symbol. If so, the Handler's resolveRetroactively method is called, to resolve the original symbol reference.

      • getId

      • checkForPathResolution

        public boolean checkForPathResolution(DeclaredEntry entry)
        If the path is now resolvable, from its original context (scope), then perform the required actions to hook up prior references to the newly defined symbol. This method should be called at the end of each Analyzer method that defines a new symbol (creates a new SymbolTable entry) for all of its attached IdentHandlers.

      • attachToEnclosingScopes

        protected void attachToEnclosingScopes()
        Attach this IdentHandler to all the NameScopes that enclose the caller.

      • removeFromAllScopes

        protected void removeFromAllScopes()
        Remove this IdentHandler from all NameScopes to which it is attached.

      • failure

        public void failure()
        To be called after all symbols have been identified. Called only on the remaining IdentHandlers.
